goal.core.agent

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.core.agent.Controller
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GOALInterpreter

    public abstract class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller for an Agent. The Controller starts a process that can be used by subclasses to drive the agents actions. This process can be stopped, started and reset through the agent.
    Author:
    mpkorstanje

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()

    • Method Detail

      • initalizeController

        protected void initalizeController(Agent<? extends Controller> agent)
                            throws KRInitFailedException
        Initializes the controller with the agent it controls. Subclasses can override this method to do their own initialization against the agent. Subclasses should take care to call super method.
        Parameters:
        agent - controlled by this controller.
        Throws:
        KRInitFailedException - when the controller could not initialize the KRLanguage.

      • isDisposedOnTermination

        public final boolean isDisposedOnTermination()
        The agent can be disposed after its process terminates. This releases any resources held by the agent which can increase performance in systems with many ephemeral agents. By default the agent is not disposed.
        Returns:
        true if the agent will be disposed after it terminates.

      • setDisposeOnTermination

        public final void setDisposeOnTermination(boolean disposeOnTermination)
        The agent can be disposed after its process terminates. This releases any resources held by the agent which can increase performance in systems with many ephemeral agents. By default the agent is not disposed.
        Parameters:
        disposeOnTermination - true if the agent should be disposed on termination.

      • getUncaughtThrowable

        public final java.lang.Throwable getUncaughtThrowable()
        Returns any throwable that was not caught during the execution of the agent.
        Returns:
        any uncaught throwable caught during the execution of the agent.

      • isRunning

        public final boolean isRunning()
        Returns true when the agent is running.
        Returns:
        true when the agent is running.

      • run

        public final void run()
        Actually starts the agent.

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        Stops the agent.

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                  KRInitFailedException
        Resets the agent. To reset the agent it is first stopped and then started again.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - when interrupted while waiting for the agent to stop.
        KRInitFailedException - when unable to initialize the KRLanguage when restarting the agent.

      • awaitTermination

        public void awaitTermination()
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Waits for the agent to terminate. This method will only return once the agent has stopped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - when interrupted while waiting for the agent to stop

      • dispose

        protected void dispose()
        Open to client implementation; does nothing by default. Called upon stop with disposeOnTermination

      • getRunnable

        protected abstract java.lang.Runnable getRunnable(java.util.concurrent.Executor pool,
                             java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.util.concurrent.Callable<?>> in)
        Runs the agent. This method is called by the Process and will have its own thread. Subclasses should implement their agents logic here. Care should be taken with regards to thread-safety and responsiveness (e.g. don't ignore interrupted exceptions).
